text: "Esta Ã‰ a Nossa PÃ¡tria Bem Amada" (; "This Is Our Well Beloved Motherland") is the national anthem of Guinea-Bissau. Written in 1963 by AmÃ­lcar Cabral (1924â€“1973) and composed by Xiao He [zh] (1918â€“2010), it was adopted upon independence from Portugal in 1974. == Lyrics == Portuguese original IPA transcription English translation I Sun, sweat, verdure and sea, Centuries of pain and hope; This is the land of our ancestors! Fruit of our hands, Of the flower of our blood: This is our beloved fatherland. Long live our glorious fatherland! The banner of the struggle has fluttered in the skies. Forward, against the foreign yoke! ğ„† We are going to build In our immortal fatherland Peace and progress! ğ„‡ II Branches of the same trunk, Eyes in the same light; This is the force of our union! The sea and the land sing, The dawn and the sun That our struggle fertilised! ==References== Category:African anthems Category:Guinea-Bissau Category:1963 works
